caption: Quiet small area next to the busy, Pont Neuf, the site of the first bridge over the river. Mooring site for one of the cruise boat companies and location of King Henry IV statue.

This place gets very busy as it has blossom trees and is clearly visible from the bridge. Having said that tho, it can be nice if you get a seat and enjoy watching people and the boats go by. Get some nice bread and wine and enjoy a little break in this busy tourist area.
Beautiful park in the middle of everything, right next to the Louvre.  River cruise boats leave from a dock right here
Great little park overlooking the river. Great little bar just across he street where you can get take away pizza. Park is down the steps behind the statue.

I always wanted to visit this small triangular parc because its location is unique, edge of the cit√© island. Seen from the boat on the river, this place looks so nice. But actually there‚Äôs almost nothing special but a willow tree at the water‚Äôs edge which gives some shades.
Small but peaceful and beautiful park üëçüèªüòç ‚Ä¶
This little park doesn't get a lot of attention from travel sites, but it's well worth a visit especially on a sunny day. Beautiful views of the Seine from a peaceful green area.
Lovely little spot with a beautiful view over the Seine. Nice place to take a picnic.  There is a water fountain here.  Very popular on a sunny day.

Perfection. A comfortable little square with plenty of seating, on the river and tucked away from the busy city We came for a little picnic and enjoyed our experience It was a beautiful place to relax and read a book, or people watch While there were a lot of people in the area they were all respectfully quiet and kept to themselves Leaving the square we were rested and relaxed
Hidden gem under Pont Neuf. Cute little Park. Beautiful views of the Bridge and the surrounding scenery, especially after dawn.

A little gem. Usually missed by the masses so quiet little spot too picnic or relax. On Pont Neuf you will see all the love locks you will also see a sign for a boat trip. Walk down the steps and you have just found a spot away from the tourists. Pick the time of day carefully as lunch time comes for the parisiens they will arrive in numbers so go before of after their lunch. Get your blanket out and enjoy this spot. As you can see in one of the photos the parisien girls came prepared to feed the five thousand.
So peaceful and wonderful.  Even more so when I got to visit while it was closed for the Olympics. I was the only person there for almost 2 hours!
pleasant place in the heart of the city. with benches and grassy areas. perfect for a little rest. clean, tidy park.

Erected in tribute to Henri IV and his numerous mistresses, the Square du Vert Galant obtained the ‚ÄòEspace vert √©cologique' (ecological green space) label in 2007. And with good reason, the square has an impressive fauna and flora considering it is situated in the centre of the capital. Consequently, the Square du Vert Galant has become one of the most popular places for romantic strolls where loving couples enjoy wonderful views of the Seine, the Mus√©e du Louvre and the H√¥tel de la Monnaie.

The tiny Square du Vert-Galant is located at the western tip of Ile de la Cite, just below the Equestrian statue of King Henri. This small park was bought by the city of Paris and converted in public space in 1884.  While being a very small area, Square du Vert-Galant is quite atmospheric and makes a great little spot to grab a park bench and rest your feet. It is a particularly nice place to visit after spending a few hours in nearby Notre Dame Cathedral and Saint Chapelle, also found at Ile de la Cite.  In addition to the nice green space, there is a bit of interesting history to this square as well. This is the supposed spot where two Order of the Temple dignitaries, Jacques de Molay and Geoffroy de Charnay were executed in March 1314. You can read about this on a plague, found on the middle pillar that forms part of Pont Neuf bridge, just below the King Henri statue.  Square du Vert-Galant is also the location where you can board some of the Seinne River boat cruises that leave from under Pont Neuf.

I really like that peaceful place where the river, on both sides is a great frontier against the noise and the city. Perfect for reading or loving and romantic couples. Bring the champagne. Go under the tree. Enjoy this Oasis
A nice green triangle on the Seine, dogs allowed, perfect view on the sunset and stairs to get there

This little 'secret' garden gem is at the tip of the island. It's a tranquil and serene area where one could picnic or relax with some wine. Not a lot of people hang out there which is great. I added a picture, not of what the square in general looks like because there's already many pictures on here, but of a particular significant rock that's located near the entrance of the Square on the grass. If you are French Canadian, more precisely 'Quebecois', this commemorative rock will be an interesting piece of knowledge for you. Click on it, zoom in and read it.
What a beautiful little hidden gem! Perfect for a walk or picnic or just enjoying the Seine.

Great view of the oldest stone bridge in Paris (pont neuf - ironically named) and great riverside chill spot for breaking out a bottle of rouge and some saucisson for an outside evening watching the boats go by. Bonus: usually a great sunset spot. Double bonus: before the French kings moved to the Louvre as their principal residence, this used to be the royal family's private garden... For a reason...
Such a beautiful spot to relax, people watch, and just be close to the Seine.

Little gem of a park to visit! Recommend walking around to appreciate a quiet place in the middle of it all.  P.S. Be very careful of groups of young girls attempting to distract and steal/pickpocket at the metro - this happened to us right at the doors. I‚Äôm going to leave this warning after all my Paris reviews so you can be prepared.
This island in Paris offers cool views Pont Neuf, Notre Dame, boats and the Seine by itself.
Maybe on of my favorite places in Paris! Loved it
Beautiful little park!!üòä I went here in autumn and tree was changing colors. Calm and nice place. ‚Ä¶

Ever since we visited the Convent of Christ in Tomar (Portugal), we wanted to know more about Jacques de Molay, the last Grand Master of the Knights Templar and his unfortunate fate. It is really horrible to see wat people do to others. When it comes to cruelty, we humans are a nasty species. What power and envy can do to one another, terrifying.
Romantic place! Good idea for take a rest and relax along the river
Beautiful place to stay an watch de sunset, it‚Äôs quite, with a little park and plenty of seats in the canal.
Nice bit of green space on the Island.
Perfect to get away from city in the center of the city.
Beautiful place to sit and watch the sunset
Great park to enjoy views of the river. Seemed popular with 20 something's and there was plenty of herb floating around.  The group's were just hanging out and having fun. I liked the place.

This little park at the other side of the island where the Notre Dame stands on, is a very quiet spot in Paris. Although you can hear the city in the background a lot of people come here to enjoy warm summer days/evenings. You can sit on the side of the river Seine and enjoy the view out. A lot of boats will pass you!

A must with the loved one(s). You will appreciate  to wander around this place in order to really feel Paris...and from there:  you can take a boat to cruise along the Seine river for an hour or so . Very romantic.
Best place to enjoy from a snack while watching boats

Love locks place. In an extremely romantique place, in the middle of the river Seine , surrounded by green and tidy trees, couples attach a lock to the guard rail. Locks are regularly removed, but lovers still place them.
A nice park with views of the river. The park itself is clean and has some seats for relaxing with friends. Some parts of the stairs reak of urine but once in the park it is undetectable.

This is the place to go at sundown, with a bottle of chilled white wine, a baguette and some smelly cheese. Sit on the edge of the park and watch the boats go by. Lots of other people will have the same idea, unfortunately, so get there a bit early and bag your spot.
